title.rendered: Launch of LESS, a Journal of Degrowth in Scotland

content.rendered:
Enough! Scotland is proud to host the online launch of LESS, a journal on degrowth, radical sufficiency and decolonisation in Scotland, on Friday, November 27 at 5pm.

Editors Mike Small, Svenja Meyerricks and Luke Devlin will introduce the main ideas behind the journal, followed by a convivial sharing of music and poetry in the style of a traditional cèilidh. BYOB.

The launch of LESS will be held on Zoom. You will receive the details how to join upon registration:

https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZYvfuyorz8tGdeJrQpJh2YpD8d35-0wGChs

Contributors to Issue 1 include Jason Hickel, Gehan Macleod, Tawona Sithole, Mike Small, Lucy Conway, Maria A Velez Serna, Ben Zachariah and Luke Devlin, with artwork by Calum Carr, Marta Adamowicz, Stewart Bremner, Deborah Mullen and Andy Arthur. The issue explores what degrowth means in Scotland during the pandemic and for plans for an economic recovery.

Subject to availability, all attendees will be sent a copy of this issue. Please indicate at registration where you’d like your copy sent to.
